pr_title: [bluetooth] Fixed bugs discovered through additional unit tests

timeline.message:
Update snapshots upon discovery completion.

Signed-off-by: Connor Petty <mistercpp2000+gitsignoff@gmail.com>

Fix code to pass new unit tests.

Signed-off-by: Connor Petty <mistercpp2000+gitsignoff@gmail.com>

Cleanup BluetoothDeviceSnapshot code

Signed-off-by: Connor Petty <mistercpp2000+gitsignoff@gmail.com>

Cleanup BluetoothDiscoveryService code

Signed-off-by: Connor Petty <mistercpp2000+gitsignoff@gmail.com>

Fix errors in Airthings caused by NonNullByDefault annotation

Signed-off-by: Connor Petty <mistercpp2000+gitsignoff@gmail.com>

timeline.bodyText: I wonder if it would not be better to return Optionals here
timeline.author: J-N-K

replies.bodyText: IMHO optionals are just a workarounds for nullability warnings. They don't actually fix potential threadsafety issues that the warnings are trying to address.
replies.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText: Mhm. I still think that they allow cleaner programming by using map & ifPresent, but ok for me.
replies.author: J-N-K
